item.title: Community Development Expert with Evaluation Experience in MENA Region (Cat II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Final evaluation of ‘Emergency Employment Investment Project’

Systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission. The focus of evaluations is on the assessment of achievements, the quality and the results of Actions in the context of an evolving cooperation policy with an increasing emphasis on result-oriented approaches and the contribution towards the implementation of the SDGs.

From this perspective, evaluations should look for evidence of why, whether or how these results are linked to the EU intervention and seek to identify the factors driving or hindering progress.

Evaluations should provide an understanding of the cause and effect links between: inputs and activities, and outputs, outcomes and impacts. Evaluations should serve accountability, decision making, learning and management purposes.

The main objectives of this evaluation are to provide the relevant services of the European Union, the interested stakeholders and the wider public with:

  • an overall independent assessment of the past performance of the Emergency Employment Investment Project, paying particular attention to its results measured against its expected objectives; and the reasons underpinning such results;
  • key lessons learned, conclusions and related recommendations in order to improve current and future Actions.

Location: The assignment will take place in Egypt with field visits in most if not all the regions targeted by the Action.

Community Development Expert with Evaluation Experience in MENA Region (Cat II)

The expert shall have a considerable experience in the area of evaluation with at least 2 evaluations conducted in the MENA region; a sound practice of development interventions in the sector of employment and community development activities, especially community works.

The expert will be a specialist of community development activities with the following requirements:

  • At least 6 years of experience in community development activities
  • At least 4 years of experience in evaluation;
  • At least 5 years of experience in the MENA region

Language skills:

  • Fluent in English;
  • Fluent in Arabic is an asset

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format

https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=4100

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

Systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission. item.title: Category 1: Two Experts in Environment/Solid Waste management (one Team Leader)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Evaluation of the National Solid Waste Management Programme (NSWMP)

Objectives of the evaluation:

Systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission. The focus of evaluations is on the assessment of achievements, the quality and the results of Actions in the context of an evolving cooperation policy with an increasing emphasis on result-oriented approaches and the contribution towards the implementation of the SDGs.

From this perspective, evaluations should look for evidence of why, whether or how these results are linked to the EU intervention and seek to identify the factors driving or hindering progress.

Evaluations should provide an understanding of the cause and effect links between: inputs and activities, and outputs, outcomes and impacts. Evaluations should serve accountability, decision making, learning and management purposes.

The main objectives of this evaluation are to provide the relevant services of the European Union, the interested stakeholders with:

  • an overall independent assessment of the past performance of the NSWMP paying particular attention to its intermediate results measured against its expected objectives; and the reasons underpinning such results;
  • key lessons learned, conclusions and related recommendations in order to improve current and future Actions (a second phase can be envisaged).

In particular, this evaluation will serve to understand the performance of the Action, its enabling factors and those hampering a proper delivery of results in order to adjust its design or implementing modalities if needed.

This midterm evaluation will serve to inform the planning of the future EU interventions and Actions in the same sector, in particular a second phase or an extension of the Programme.

Project duration: 120 days maximum

Expert 1 - Category 1: Expert in Environment/Solid Waste management (Team Leader)

Education

The expert should have at least a Master’s Degree in a domain relevant to the project or, in its absence, a Bachelor Degree and additional equivalent professional experience of at least three years in evaluation of development projects (the equivalent experience must be above the general experience duration fixed below).

General professional experience:

At least 12 years’ experience in development cooperation.

Specific professional experience:

  • Experience in at least 2 projects in the field of solid waste management;
  • Proven experience in at least 3 assignments in the field of monitoring and evaluating development projects funded through the EU or other international cooperation programmes;
  • Demonstrable knowledge of, and experience with, EU rules and procedures, Project Cycle Management and EU led project/programme evaluation;
  • Experience in working in countries of the European Neighbourhood. Experience in the MENA region will be an asset.

Additional requirement for TL: At least 2 significant experiences as Team Leader in designing, monitoring and/or evaluation of projects in the field of access to finance/finance facilities.

Language skills:

  • English: The expert must have excellent command of English (speaking and writing skills). (C1 minimum);
  • Arabic: knowledge or good command would be an asset (B1 or above).

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format

https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=4090

item.title: Expert in Industrial Development – (cat 1).
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Final Evaluation of the Trade Development & Market Enhancement Programme

DESCRIPTION OF THE ASSIGNEMENT:

Systematic and timely evaluation of the Trade Development & Market Enhancement Programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission. The focus of evaluations is on the assessment of achievements, the quality and the results of Actions in the context of an evolving cooperation policy with an increasing emphasis on result-oriented approaches and the contribution towards the implementation of the SDGs.

From this perspective, evaluations should look for evidence of why, whether or how these results are linked to the EU intervention and seek to identify the factors driving or hindering progress.

Evaluations should provide an understanding of the cause and effect links between: inputs and activities, and outputs, outcomes and impacts. Evaluations should serve accountability, decision making, learning and management purposes.

The main objectives of this evaluation are to provide the relevant services of the European Union, the interested stakeholder with:

  • An overall independent assessment of the past performance of the Trade Development & Market Enhancement Programme, paying particular attention to its results measured against its expected objectives; and the reasons underpinning such results;
  • Detailed recommendations in order to design future Actions on the basis of the key lessons learned and conclusions of this implementation.

In particular, this evaluation will serve to understand the performance of the Action, its enabling factors and those hampering a proper delivery of results as to feed the planning of future EU interventions and Actions in the same sector.

Expert 2 - Expert in Industrial Development – (30 d., cat 1).

Qualifications:

  • The expert should have at least a master’s Degree in economics, engineering, business administration or other relevant discipline or, in its absence, a Bachelor’s Degree and an additional equivalent professional experience of at least 5 years in a field related to the program (the equivalent experience must be above the general experience duration fixed below).

General professional experience:

  • At least 12 years ‘experience in experience in economic analysis in industry sector development related fields

Specific professional experience:

  • The expert should be familiar with the principles and methods of the EU evaluations.
  • At least 10 years of experience in evaluation/monitoring/designing of development programmes.
  • Significant experience in designing, monitoring and/or evaluation of projects in the field of industrial development (3 different references to be given as a minimum); such experience in EU led-projects/program evaluations will be an asset.
  • Experience of working in Neighbourhood South countries will be considered as an asset

Language skills: The experts must have excellent command of English (speaking and writing skills).

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=4082

item.title: Expert in Trade, Team Leader (Cat 1).
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Final Evaluation of the Trade Development & Market Enhancement Programme

DESCRIPTION OF THE ASSIGNEMENT:

Systematic and timely evaluation of the Trade Development & Market Enhancement Programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission. The focus of evaluations is on the assessment of achievements, the quality and the results of Actions in the context of an evolving cooperation policy with an increasing emphasis on result-oriented approaches and the contribution towards the implementation of the SDGs.

From this perspective, evaluations should look for evidence of why, whether or how these results are linked to the EU intervention and seek to identify the factors driving or hindering progress.

Evaluations should provide an understanding of the cause and effect links between: inputs and activities, and outputs, outcomes and impacts. Evaluations should serve accountability, decision making, learning and management purposes.

The main objectives of this evaluation are to provide the relevant services of the European Union, the interested stakeholder with:

  1. An overall independent assessment of the past performance of the Trade Development & Market Enhancement Programme, paying particular attention to its results measured against its expected objectives; and the reasons underpinning such results;
  2. Detailed recommendations in order to design future Actions on the basis of the key lessons learned and conclusions of this implementation.

In particular, this evaluation will serve to understand the performance of the Action, its enabling factors and those hampering a proper delivery of results as to feed the planning of future EU interventions and Actions in the same sector.

Expert 1 - Expert in Trade, Team Leader (30d., Cat 1).

Qualifications:

  1. The expert should have at least a master’s Degree in economics, law, business administration or other relevant discipline, or in its absence, a Bachelor Degree and an additional equivalent professional experience of at least 5 years in a field related to the program (the equivalent experience must be above the general experience duration fixed below).

General professional experience

  1. At least 12 years’ experience in economic analysis in trade policy and trade development related fields.

Specific professional experience

  1. The expert should be familiar with the principles and methods of the EU evaluations.
  2. At least 10 years of experience in the field of evaluation of development programmes, such experience gained in the field of trade development will be an asset.
  3. At least 3 significant experiences as Team Leader in designing, monitoring and/or evaluation of projects in the field of trade development; such experience in EU led-projects/program evaluations will be an asset.
  4. Experience of working in Neighbourhood South countries will be considered as an asset.

Language skills: The expert must have excellent command of English (speaking and writing skills).

item.title: Senior Expert in Environment, Climate Change or Natural Resource Management with M&E Experience
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Ex-post Evaluation of the ‘Support to Rural Livelihoods and Climate Change Adaptation in the Himalayas’ project ASIE/2012/292-464

The main objectives of this evaluation are to provide the relevant services of the European Union, the interested stakeholders and the wider public with:

  • an overall independent assessment of the past performance of the ‘Support to rural livelihoods and climate change adaptation in the Himalaya, paying particular attention to its results measured against its expected objectives; and the reasons underpinning such results;
  • key lessons learned, conclusions and related recommendations in order to improve current and future Actions.

In particular, this evaluation will serve as an independent assessment of the:

  • extent to which the project has achieved its intended results at target countries and at regional level,
  • the levels of influence and effectiveness of core components of the project design viz action research, pilots, policy, capacity building and knowledge sharing in enhancing the resilience of the mountain communities in HKH region,
  • ICIMOD’s comparative advantages and challenges in view of potential future cooperation and EU priorities in the region, and enhancing the EU visibility in the region
  • identify good practices, lessons learnt case studies, models for potential adaptation / replication, which can be built upon / synergize with the existing EU instruments in the region (e.g. SWITCH Asia, bilateral programmes, thematic initiatives, Asia Investment Facility etc) and collaborations with the respective EU Delegations in the region.

The main users of this evaluation will be EU, ICIMOD, partner country governments, donors and CSOs in the HKH region.

Category I expert

Minimum requirements:

  • at least a master’s degree in environmental science, development studies, climate change, natural resource management, or related fields, OR equivalent professional experience of at least 15 years in the sector if the candidate does not possess a Master
  • a minimum of 12 years of professional experience in the field of environment, climate change, Natural Resource Management,
  • minimum of 5 experiences in evaluation and monitoring of development co-operation projects, financed by different types of Donors/Institutions, like the European Union, bilateral donors and multilateral institutions in the field of environment, climate change and development programmes;
  • at least 3 experiences as team leader
  • previous experience in conducting complex multi-country and multi stakeholder evaluations.

Additional requirements:

  • desirable experience in South Asian / HKH Countries9 (preferably in the mountain context) and in understanding the complex geo-political / social-cultural environment
  • expertise in evaluating regional and research for development types of organisations and programme ideally linked to livelihoods, water, NRM, climate change, transboundary and ecosystems solutions.

Language skills of the team: English: evaluation expert shall possess a level C2 expertise;

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format

https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=4012

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert(e) en questions de genre dans les projets de développement
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation à mi-parcours du Programme d'actions pilote pour le développement rural et l'agriculture en Algérie (PAP-ENPARD)

Objectif de l’évaluation

Une évaluation systématique et opportune de ses programmes et de ses activités est une priorité établie de la Commission européenne. L’évaluation se concentre sur l’analyse des réalisations, l’atteinte et la qualité des résultats de l’action, dans le contexte d’une politique de coopération en constante évolution, avec un accent de plus en plus marqué sur les approches orientées sur les résultats. De ce point de vue, les évaluateurs devraient trouver les preuves expliquant les raisons, les cas de figure et la manière dont ces résultats sont liés à l’intervention de l’UE et essayer d’identifier les facteurs générant ou entravant le progrès.

Les évaluateurs doivent fournir une explication des liens de cause à effet existant entre les intrants et les activités, et les extrants, les résultats et les impacts. Le travail des évaluateurs doit encourager la responsabilisation, la prise de décisions, l’apprentissage et la gestion.

Cette évaluation est principalement vouée à fournir aux services compétents de l’Union Européenne, aux parties prenantes intéressées :

  • une analyse globale et indépendante de la performance qu’a eu le PAP-ENPARD, en prêtant une attention particulière à ses résultats intermédiaires, en comparaison avec les objectifs fixés ;
  • des leçons et des recommandations, de manière à améliorer, le cas échéant, les actions présentes et futures.

En particulier, cette évaluation servira à proposer, le cas échéant, des mesures correctives en vue de la finalisation du programme prévue en décembre 2019 et de sa phase de clôture successive.

Les principaux utilisateurs de cette évaluation seront la Délégation de l'Union européenne en Algérie et la Coordination nationale du PAP-ENPARD.

Expert 4: Expert(e) en questions de genre dans les projets de développement

Catégorie et durée de l'expérience équivalente Catégorie II, 6 ans

Formation:

Il/elle doit avoir un diplôme de niveau Master.

En l'absence de diplôme niveau Master, une expérience professionnelle additionnelle de 3 ans dans la thématique genre est requise.

Expérience

Expérience professionnelle générale

Avoir au moins 6 ans et préférablement 9 ans d'expérience professionnelle dans le secteur de la coopération au développement.

Expérience professionnelle spécifique

Expérience considérée comme indispensable :

  • Avoir une expérience avérée dans l'intégration des aspects d'égalité des chances hommes/femmes dans les projets ou programmes de développement (au moins 4 expériences)
  • Avoir animé des ateliers, y compris en tant que formateur/formatrice, dans l'intégration des aspects d'égalité des chances hommes/femmes dans les projets ou programmes de développement (au moins 3 expériences).

Expériences considérées comme des atouts supplémentaires :

  • Avoir participé à des missions d'évaluation de projets/programmes de coopération au développement;
  • Avoir une connaissance de la région.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format

https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=4007

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert(e) en réseaux associatifs
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation à mi-parcours du Programme d'actions pilote pour le développement rural et l'agriculture en Algérie (PAP-ENPARD)

Objectif de l’évaluation

Une évaluation systématique et opportune de ses programmes et de ses activités est une priorité établie de la Commission européenne. L’évaluation se concentre sur l’analyse des réalisations, l’atteinte et la qualité des résultats de l’action, dans le contexte d’une politique de coopération en constante évolution, avec un accent de plus en plus marqué sur les approches orientées sur les résultats. De ce point de vue, les évaluateurs devraient trouver les preuves expliquant les raisons, les cas de figure et la manière dont ces résultats sont liés à l’intervention de l’UE et essayer d’identifier les facteurs générant ou entravant le progrès.

Les évaluateurs doivent fournir une explication des liens de cause à effet existant entre les intrants et les activités, et les extrants, les résultats et les impacts. Le travail des évaluateurs doit encourager la responsabilisation, la prise de décisions, l’apprentissage et la gestion.

Cette évaluation est principalement vouée à fournir aux services compétents de l’Union Européenne, aux parties prenantes intéressées :

  • une analyse globale et indépendante de la performance qu’a eu le PAP-ENPARD, en prêtant une attention particulière à ses résultats intermédiaires, en comparaison avec les objectifs fixés ;
  • des leçons et des recommandations, de manière à améliorer, le cas échéant, les actions présentes et futures.

En particulier, cette évaluation servira à proposer, le cas échéant, des mesures correctives en vue de la finalisation du programme prévue en décembre 2019 et de sa phase de clôture successive.

Les principaux utilisateurs de cette évaluation seront la Délégation de l'Union européenne en Algérie et la Coordination nationale du PAP-ENPARD.

Expert 3: Expert(e) en réseaux associatifs

Catégorie et durée de l'expérience équivalente Catégorie II, 6 ans

Formation:

Il/elle doit avoir un diplôme de niveau Master.

En l'absence de diplôme niveau Master, une expérience professionnelle additionnelle de 3 ans en lien avec l'accompagnement ou le suivi et évaluation des réseaux associatifs ou de projets réalisés par les organismes de la société civile est requise.

*Expérience *

Expérience professionnelle générale

Avoir au moins 6 ans et préférablement 9 ans d'expérience professionnelle dans le milieu associatif.

Expérience professionnelle spécifique

Expérience considérée comme indispensable: -

  • Avoir une expérience confirmée dans l'accompagnement ou le suivi et évaluation des réseaux associatifs ou de projets réalisés par les organismes de la société civile (minimum 3 expériences)
  • Avoir une expérience prouvée dans l’animation des réseaux associatifs ou de projets portés par les organismes de la société civile (minimum 1 expérience).

Expériences considérées comme des atouts supplémentaires:

  • Avoir participé à des missions d'accompagnement ou de suivi/évaluation dans le cadre de projets de coopération au développement;
  • Avoir une connaissance directe du milieu associatif de la région, et notamment de l'Algérie.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format

https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=4006

item.title: Expert(e) sectoriel
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation à mi-parcours du Programme d'actions pilote pour le développement rural et l'agriculture en Algérie (PAP-ENPARD)

Objectif de l’évaluation

Une évaluation systématique et opportune de ses programmes et de ses activités est une priorité établie de la Commission européenne. L’évaluation se concentre sur l’analyse des réalisations, l’atteinte et la qualité des résultats de l’action, dans le contexte d’une politique de coopération en constante évolution, avec un accent de plus en plus marqué sur les approches orientées sur les résultats. De ce point de vue, les évaluateurs devraient trouver les preuves expliquant les raisons, les cas de figure et la manière dont ces résultats sont liés à l’intervention de l’UE et essayer d’identifier les facteurs générant ou entravant le progrès.

Les évaluateurs doivent fournir une explication des liens de cause à effet existant entre les intrants et les activités, et les extrants, les résultats et les impacts. Le travail des évaluateurs doit encourager la responsabilisation, la prise de décisions, l’apprentissage et la gestion.

Cette évaluation est principalement vouée à fournir aux services compétents de l’Union Européenne, aux parties prenantes intéressées :

  • une analyse globale et indépendante de la performance qu’a eu le PAP-ENPARD, en prêtant une attention particulière à ses résultats intermédiaires, en comparaison avec les objectifs fixés ;
  • des leçons et des recommandations, de manière à améliorer, le cas échéant, les actions présentes et futures.

En particulier, cette évaluation servira à proposer, le cas échéant, des mesures correctives en vue de la finalisation du programme prévue en décembre 2019 et de sa phase de clôture successive.

Les principaux utilisateurs de cette évaluation seront la Délégation de l'Union européenne en Algérie et la Coordination nationale du PAP-ENPARD.

Expert 2: Expert(e) sectoriel

Catégorie et durée de l'expérience équivalente Catégorie II, 6 ans

Formation:

Il/elle doit avoir un diplôme de niveau Master.

En l'absence de diplôme niveau Master, une expérience professionnelle additionnelle de 3 ans dans un ou plusieurs domaines d'intervention du programme (cfr. résultats du programme) est requise.

Expérience

Expérience professionnelle générale

Avoir au moins 6 ans et préférablement 9 ans d’expérience professionnelle dans un ou plusieurs domaines d'intervention du programme (cfr. résultats du programme).

Expérience professionnelle spécifique

Expérience considérée comme indispensable: -

  • Avoir une expérience confirmée dans la gestion des actions de développement dans les domaines d'intervention du programme: au moins cinq (5) interventions en lien avec les thèmes abordés par le programme (cfr. résultats du programme); -
  • Avoir participé à au moins deux (2) missions d’évaluation.

Expériences considérées comme des atouts supplémentaires: -

  • Avoir été membre d'une équipe d'assistance technique pour la mise en œuvre d'une politique nationale d'agriculture et/ou développement rural;
  • Avoir participé à des missions ou des projets portant sur les thématiques de la protection de l'environnement.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format

https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=4005

item.title: Chef(fe) de mission, Expert(e) évaluateur
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation à mi-parcours du Programme d'actions pilote pour le développement rural et l'agriculture en Algérie (PAP-ENPARD)

Objectif de l’évaluation

Une évaluation systématique et opportune de ses programmes et de ses activités est une priorité établie de la Commission européenne. L’évaluation se concentre sur l’analyse des réalisations, l’atteinte et la qualité des résultats de l’action, dans le contexte d’une politique de coopération en constante évolution, avec un accent de plus en plus marqué sur les approches orientées sur les résultats. De ce point de vue, les évaluateurs devraient trouver les preuves expliquant les raisons, les cas de figure et la manière dont ces résultats sont liés à l’intervention de l’UE et essayer d’identifier les facteurs générant ou entravant le progrès.

Les évaluateurs doivent fournir une explication des liens de cause à effet existant entre les intrants et les activités, et les extrants, les résultats et les impacts. Le travail des évaluateurs doit encourager la responsabilisation, la prise de décisions, l’apprentissage et la gestion.

Cette évaluation est principalement vouée à fournir aux services compétents de l’Union Européenne, aux parties prenantes intéressées :

  • une analyse globale et indépendante de la performance qu’a eu le PAP-ENPARD, en prêtant une attention particulière à ses résultats intermédiaires, en comparaison avec les objectifs fixés ;
  • des leçons et des recommandations, de manière à améliorer, le cas échéant, les actions présentes et futures.

En particulier, cette évaluation servira à proposer, le cas échéant, des mesures correctives en vue de la finalisation du programme prévue en décembre 2019 et de sa phase de clôture successive.

Les principaux utilisateurs de cette évaluation seront la Délégation de l'Union européenne en Algérie et la Coordination nationale du PAP-ENPARD.

Expert 1: Chef(fe) de mission, Expert(e) évaluateur

Formation:

Il/elle doit avoir un diplôme de niveau Master. En l'absence de diplôme niveau Master, une expérience professionnelle additionnelle de 3 ans dans un ou plusieurs domaines d'intervention du programme (cfr. résultats du programme) est requise.

Expérience

Expérience professionnelle générale Avoir au moins 12 ans et préférablement 15 ans d’expérience professionnelle dans le secteur de la coopération au développement.

Expérience professionnelle spécifique

Expérience considérée comme indispensable :

  • Avoir une expérience confirmée dans la coordination et l’encadrement d'équipes dans le cadre des projets de coopération au développement: avoir été chef d’équipe ou chef de mission dans au moins trois (3) missions ou contrats d'assistance technique;
  • Avoir participé à au moins trois (3) missions d’évaluation.

Expériences considérées comme des atouts supplémentaires : -

  • Avoir été formateur dans le cycle du projet et la gestion du cadre logique des projets;
  • Avoir une connaissance de la région.

item.title: Expert 4 Expert in Design/ Implementation/ Evaluation of Development Cooperation Programmes (Cat III)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Evaluation of the Livelihoods and Food Security Trust Fund for Myanmar (LIFT)

Objectives of the evaluation:

Systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission. The focus of evaluations is on the assessment of achievements, the quality and the results of Actions in the context of an evolving cooperation policy with an increasing emphasis on result-oriented approaches and the contribution towards the implementation of the SDGs.

From this perspective, evaluations should look for evidence of why, whether or how these results are linked to the EU intervention and seek to identify the factors driving or hindering progress.

Evaluations should provide an understanding of the cause and effect links between: inputs and activities, and outputs, outcomes and impacts. Evaluations should serve accountability, decision making, learning and management purposes.

The main objectives of this mid-evaluation are to provide the relevant services of the European Union and the interested stakeholders with:

  • an overall independent assessment of the past performance of the Livelihoods and Food Security Trust Fund for Myanmar (LIFT), paying particular attention to its intermediate results measured against its expected objectives; and the reasons underpinning such results;
  • key lessons learned, conclusions and related recommendations in order to improve current and future Actions.

In particular, the evaluation of LIFT will inform the EU Delegation on the best possible approaches to maximise added-value, impact and effectiveness of future contributions to the sector on the basis of the following analyses:

  • Consistency, synergies and alignment of LIFT with government and donor policies and programmes in the sector.
  • Implementation progress of the programme against set targets.
  • Relevance and consistency of the LIFT Strategy 2014-2018, including the Theory of Change.
  • Relevance and efficiency of the logical framework for measuring the expected outcomes for the end beneficiaries.
  • Reliability and accuracy of annual target and achievement values of result indicators.
  • Coherence between contextual analysis and implementation mechanisms, including selection of activities and targeting of end beneficiaries.
  • Time and cost-efficiency of the contracting and implementation arrangements of the programme.
  • Transparency, accountability, efficiency and effectiveness of the governance and management mechanisms of the programme.

Expert 4 Expert in Design/Implementation/Evaluation of Development Cooperation Programmes (Cat III)

Qualifications and skills:

  • education at least University Degree in in field(s) related to agriculture, food security and rural development or, in its absence, equivalent professional experience of at least 1 year above the minimum general professional experience duration fixed below

General professional experience:

  • at least 3 years of proven experience in design, implementation and/or evaluation of development cooperation programmes

Specific professional experience:

  • at least 1 year of proven experience in evaluation of projects and/or programmes supporting rural development, agriculture or related fields in Myanmar

Soft skills:

  • proven quality reporting skills;

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3979

Experts in Evaluation/Implementation of Food Security/Nutrition Programmes (Cat II)

  • proven experience in analysis of currency exchange hedging and guarantee funds related to microfinancing will be an asset

item.title: Legal Expert (Category II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance to the Contracting Authority in decentralised management for the management of infrastructural projects under IPA TAIB and IPA NAP

Global Objective

The global objective of this contract will be as follows: To further strengthen the administrative and managerial capacity of the Decentralized Management structure for the management of the EU financial aid to the Republic of Serbia to effectively and efficiently manage EU funded infrastructural projects.

Specific Objective (s)

The specific objective of this contract will be as follows: Improved capacity of the Department for Contracting and Financing of the EU Funded Programmes, of the Serbian Ministry of Finance (CFCU), to award contracts, manage and monitor implementation and duly address outstanding legal and procedural issues arising in the course of preparation and implementation of infrastructural IPA 2013, 2014, 2015 and possibly 2017 projects managed under indirect management mode.

Legal Expert (Category II)

The Key Expert 2 will assist the Team Leader in project report drafting, organization and execution of project related trainings, OTSCs and site visits, and provide advisory services to the CFCU staff in line with the section 2.3. Requested services.

Qualifications and skills • At least Master Degree in law, or alternatively, Bachelor Degree in the same field plus additional 3 years of general professional experience above the general professional experience duration fixed below;

General professional experience • At least 6, preferably 8 years of post-graduate professional experience in law and/or procurement;

Specific professional experience • At least 3, preferably 5 years of experience in providing legal assistance related to the issues arising from the implementation of infrastructural contracts concluded under PRAG and FIDIC; • At least 3, preferably 5 years of experience in managing legal/procurement issues related to tenders’ complaint and/or disputes;

Assets • Experience in providing trainings on PRAG and/or FIDIC conditions of contract;

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format.

https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3976

item.title: Team Leader / FIDIC Expert (Category I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance to the Contracting Authority in decentralised management for the management of infrastructural projects under IPA TAIB and IPA NAP

Global Objective

The global objective of this contract will be as follows: To further strengthen the administrative and managerial capacity of the Decentralized Management structure for the management of the EU financial aid to the Republic of Serbia to effectively and efficiently manage EU funded infrastructural projects.

Specific Objective (s)

The specific objective of this contract will be as follows: Improved capacity of the Department for Contracting and Financing of the EU Funded Programmes, of the Serbian Ministry of Finance (CFCU), to award contracts, manage and monitor implementation and duly address outstanding legal and procedural issues arising in the course of preparation and implementation of infrastructural IPA 2013, 2014, 2015 and possibly 2017 projects managed under indirect management mode.

Team Leader / FIDIC Expert (Category I)

The Team Leader will execute, coordinate and manage the project activities. Se/he will ensure the timely and effective implementation of the services and achievement of results, through the proposed tasks. She/he is responsible for liaison between the CA, Project Beneficiary/CFCU and project team and must ensure that the experts inputs and the working days are distributed in the most efficient and effective manner. She/he will be responsible for ensuring management of the project and timely delivery of outputs.

Qualifications and skills

  • At least Master’s Degree in civil engineering, or alternatively Bachelor Degree in the same field plus additional 3 years of general professional experience above the general professional experience duration fixed below;

General professional experience

  • At least 12, preferably 15 years of postgraduate professional experience in the field of civil engineering;

Specific professional experience

  • Professional experience in at least 3, preferably 5 completed projects either as the “Engineer” in projects implemented under FIDIC conditions of contract or as head of unit/senior project manager of EU funded works contracts
  • Postgraduate professional experience as a team leader/senior project manager, or similar leading position, in at least 2, preferably 3 infrastructural projects worth at least 300.000 EUR each;
  • Experience in at least 1, preferably 2 works contracts implemented under PRAG conditions of contract

Assets

  • Experience in providing training on FIDIC conditions of contract

item.title: Expert 3 - en planification stratégique et analyse des programme (catégorie III)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project

Objectifs généraux

L'objectif global de ce contrat est de contribuer à l'’amélioration de la performance et l’efficacité de l’administration publique pour accompagner le développement économique et social du pays.

Objectifs particuliers

  • Elaborer un diagnostic et proposer un projet de réforme de l'administration et la fonction publique en République de Djibouti.
  • Renforcement des capacités du SECRA pour mettre en œuvre la réforme de l'administration.

Experience and Qualifications required

Diplômé de l’enseignement supérieur d'un niveau d'au moins Masters I (4 ans d’études supérieures) dans les domaines de planification stratégique, des sciences de gestion, management public ou autres disciplines équivalentes, il devra avoir

un excellent niveau de français.

Cet expert devra avoir au moins 3 ans d’expérience, notamment dans des projets d'appui institutionnel. La connaissance de l’administration publique djiboutienne serait un atout.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format

External CWS using Project-Proposal UK Application Form Link to job posting: https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3971

item.description:
Description of Project

Objectifs généraux

L'objectif global de ce contrat est de contribuer à l'’amélioration de la performance et l’efficacité de l’administration publique pour accompagner le développement économique et social du pays.

Objectifs particuliers

  • Elaborer un diagnostic et proposer un projet de réforme de l'administration et la fonction publique en République de Djibouti.
  • Renforcement des capacités du SECRA pour mettre en œuvre la réforme de l'administration.

Experience and Qualifications required

Diplômé de l’enseignement supérieur d'un niveau d'au moins Masters I (4 ans d’études supérieures) dans les domaines des sciences de gestion, management public, planification stratégique ou autres disciplines équivalentes.

Avec un minimum de 10 années d’expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de la réforme de la fonction publique et les appuis institutionnels.

Un excellent niveau de français oral et écrit est indispensable.

L'expert spécialisé dans la réforme de la fonction publique disposera d’une expertise d'au moins 5 ans sur l'élaboration et mise en œuvre des réformes de l'Administration et établissements publiques, notamment dans des pays en développement.

item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project

Objectifs généraux

L'objectif global de ce contrat est de contribuer à l'’amélioration de la performance et l’efficacité de l’administration publique pour accompagner le développement économique et social du pays.

Objectifs particuliers

  • Elaborer un diagnostic et proposer un projet de réforme de l'administration et la fonction publique en République de Djibouti.
  • Renforcement des capacités du SECRA pour mettre en œuvre la réforme de l'administration.

Il aura déjà dirigé des missions pour la réforme des administrations publiques, le rendant apte à organiser et manager celle-ci. Il devra avoir.

item.title: Technical Experts (x2) - (Cat III)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project:

Global objective

The overall objective of the programme, of which this contract is a part, is to prepare the Turkish Cypriot community for the implementation of the acquis communautaire in the sector of energy in general and in regard to energy efficiency, beginning with schools, in particular.

Specific objective(s)

  • To provide the Contracting Authority and the Beneficiary with a comprehensive assessment regarding the energy efficiency situation in 10 pilot schools (the list of the schools will be provided by the Beneficiary at the start of the assignment).

  • To provide the Contracting Authority and the Beneficiary with a clear and sustainable action plan for energy efficiency in the 10 pilot schools.

  • To assist the Contracting Authority and the Beneficiary in implementing the energy efficiency measures foreseen in the feasibility studies of the 10 schools.

  • To make specific recommendations for future support in the area of energy efficiency in schools in the Turkish Cypriot community based on the assessment of the situation in the pilot schools.

  • To increase awareness on energy efficiency in the schools and of relevant stakeholders such as professional chambers and local communities.

  • To increase skills in energy auditing of practitioners and consumers.

Requested Services

To conduct a comprehensive assessment of the situation in the 10 pilot schools including (but not limited to):

  • Carry out energy performance audits of the 10 schools and draft Energy Audit Reports. Data on energy consumption of the schools will be provided by the Beneficiary; however, their quality and format may not be fully reliable. Equipment to carry out the audits (infrared cameras, leak detectors, light meter, CO detector, etc.) will be provided by the contractor. It is expected that these tools will not be easily available for rent in Cyprus.

  • Assessment of current local procedures and tools for measuring energy consumption in buildings and provision of recommendations to improve it.

  • Review of implementation and effectiveness of applicable local requirements in the sector of energy efficiency in schools.

  • Prepare a Feasibility Study for measures to increase energy efficiency for each of the 10 schools (renovation/retrofitting strategies, smart metering, changes in behaviour, needs of awareness and training, etc.). The study will provide cost/benefit scenarios for different levels of increases in energy efficiency including analysis on equipment and human resources required to carry out the measures.

  • Identify training and capacity building needs within the 10 schools with a view to implementing energy efficiency practices (in accordance with best practices and the EU acquis communautaire).

  • Review other EU funded projects on energy efficiency in schools.

Experience and Qualifications required

Education (Minimum requirement):

  • A degree, preferably in a related field or, in its absence, 2 years of equivalent professional experience above the general professional experience duration fixed below (i.e. 3 + 2 = 5 years of general professional experience).

General Professional Experience (Minimum requirement):

  • At least 3 years of professional experience in the field of energy efficiency in buildings or energy audits in buildings.

  • At least 2 years of project management experience.

Recommended:

  • Knowledge of EU Directives and Regulations in the field of energy efficiency, including energy performance of buildings.

  • Experience in conducting energy audits of buildings is a strong advantage.

Language skills

  • Excellent command of written and spoken English.

  • Command of written and spoken Turkish is a strong advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format External CWS using Project-Proposal UK Application Form Link to job posting: https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3967

item.title: Team Leader - Cat I
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project:

Global objective

The overall objective of the programme, of which this contract is a part, is to prepare the Turkish Cypriot community for the implementation of the acquis communautaire in the sector of energy in general and in regard to energy efficiency, beginning with schools, in particular.

Specific objective(s)

  • To provide the Contracting Authority and the Beneficiary with a comprehensive assessment regarding the energy efficiency situation in 10 pilot schools (the list of the schools will be provided by the Beneficiary at the start of the assignment).

  • To provide the Contracting Authority and the Beneficiary with a clear and sustainable action plan for energy efficiency in the 10 pilot schools.

  • To assist the Contracting Authority and the Beneficiary in implementing the energy efficiency measures foreseen in the feasibility studies of the 10 schools.

  • To make specific recommendations for future support in the area of energy efficiency in schools in the Turkish Cypriot community based on the assessment of the situation in the pilot schools.

  • To increase awareness on energy efficiency in the schools and of relevant stakeholders such as professional chambers and local communities.

  • To increase skills in energy auditing of practitioners and consumers.

Requested Services

To conduct a comprehensive assessment of the situation in the 10 pilot schools including (but not limited to):

  • Carry out energy performance audits of the 10 schools and draft Energy Audit Reports. Data on energy consumption of the schools will be provided by the Beneficiary; however, their quality and format may not be fully reliable. Equipment to carry out the audits (infrared cameras, leak detectors, light meter, CO detector, etc.) will be provided by the contractor. It is expected that these tools will not be easily available for rent in Cyprus.

  • Assessment of current local procedures and tools for measuring energy consumption in buildings and provision of recommendations to improve it.

  • Review of implementation and effectiveness of applicable local requirements in the sector of energy efficiency in schools.

  • Prepare a Feasibility Study for measures to increase energy efficiency for each of the 10 schools (renovation/retrofitting strategies, smart metering, changes in behaviour, needs of awareness and training, etc.). The study will provide cost/benefit scenarios for different levels of increases in energy efficiency including analysis on equipment and human resources required to carry out the measures.

  • Identify training and capacity building needs within the 10 schools with a view to implementing energy efficiency practices (in accordance with best practices and the EU acquis communautaire).

  • Review other EU funded projects on energy efficiency in schools.

Experience and Qualifications required

Education (Minimum requirement):

  • Master’s degree in energy, energy efficiency, renewable energy or a relevant related field or, in its absence, 5 years of equivalent professional experience above the general professional experience duration fixed below (i.e. 12 + 5 = 17 years of general professional experience in the energy sector).

General Professional Experience (Minimum requirement):

  • At least 12 years of professional experience in the fields of energy and energy efficiency in buildings (cumulative).

  • At least 3 years of experience in conducting energy audits of buildings.

  • At least 5 years of experience in identifying measures for retrofitting existing public buildings to increase energy performance and drafting related technical specifications.

Recommended:

  • Good knowledge of EU Directives and Regulations in the field of energy efficiency, including energy performance of buildings.

  • 5 years of professional experience as a Manager or Team Leader in implementing and/or managing energy efficiency in buildings programmes.

  • Experience with EU funded projects and applicable procurement rules (following the PRAG).

Language skills

  • Excellent command of written and spoken English.

  • Command of written and spoken Turkish is a strong advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format External CWS using Project-Proposal UK Application Form Link to job posting: https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3966
